channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Many Covid-19 testing centres closing down
item.description: Dozens of Covid-19 community based testing centres around the country are closing down.

item.title: 'Music is my rehab': Anika Moa finds niche performing for kids
item.description: Writing and performing children's music is the perfect way to lift spirits and not load up a partner or your kids with any problems, says Tui award winner Anika Moa.

item.title: Christchurch motorists warned of delays as new motorway sections open
item.description: Christchurch drivers are being warned to expect delays as people get used to new layout on the Christchurch Southern Motorway.

item.title: No new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand, still one active case
item.description: There have been no new cases of Covid-19 reported in New Zealand for the eighth straight day, with just one active case still remaining in New Zealand.

item.title: Domestic tourists get busy travelling New Zealand
item.description: Airports are busy around the country as people spread their wings after lockdown, for the long weekend.

item.title: Appeal for witnesses after 82yo woman injured in street robbery
item.description: An 82-year-old woman has been robbed on central city street in Palmerston North today.

item.title: Severe weather warning for upper North Island
item.description: Heavy rain and possibly severe gales are set to hit the north of the country from tomorrow.

item.title: Asians reluctant to seek help for mental health reach out during pandemic
item.description: A charity offering mental health support to Asians says a sharp rise in those seeking help shows a long-term plan is needed to help those in need.

item.title: Report into troubled NZTA department withheld
item.description: The Transport Agency has refused to release an inquiry into potential conflicts of interest over high-tech contracts.

item.title: Police Eagle helicopters called out more than 16 times a day
item.description: Police are using the Eagle helicopters for an average of more than 16 incidents a day, at a cost to taxpayers of more than $2000 an hour.

item.title: Auckland reservoirs 34 percent below usual capacity
item.description: Heavy rain in Auckland this week has done little to relieve the city's water shortage.

item.title: Search for missing woman continues
item.description: The search for a missing woman in the Hunua Ranges will continue today, weather permitting.

item.title: Warning as more people head off for outdoor adventures
item.description: Outdoor explorers are being warned against venturing out beyond their limits this long weekend.

item.title: Poliec find man reported missing in central Dunedin
item.description: Police have found a man who was reported missing in central Dunedin.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened in NZ and around the world on 29 May
item.description: The government announces a $175 million arts and creative sector recovery package, Auckland and Wellington take financial hits due to Covid-19 and there were no new cases today.

item.title: Covid-19: 'It's a risk management exercise at this point'
item.description: There is now only one active case of Covid-19 in the country, but an expert on data modelling is warning there will be fresh challenges ahead.

item.title: Covid-19: Auction tests demand for Queenstown property
item.description: Bidders in Queenstown have started testing the water in one of the country's most expensive property markets.

item.title: Artists and musicians mostly 'thrilled' by new govt funding for arts
item.description: Many artists and musicians are welcoming a $175 million government package aimed at protecting 90,000 jobs.
